name: sbsbc
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0
body: |- wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0))

stmt.origin: ax-mp(wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(s0)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0))
-| wceq(cv(s0), cv(s0))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s0)), wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0))
-| wceq(cv(s0), cv(s0))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s0)), wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)))

|- wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s0)), wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)))

body.origin: |- wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s0)), wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0)))

cumulated.origin: |- wb(wsb(s0, s1, w0), wsbc(s1, cv(s0), w0))

comment: Show that ~ df-sb and ~ df-sbc are equivalent when the class term ` A ` in ~ df-sbc is a setvar variable. This theorem lets us reuse theorems based on ~ df-sb for proofs involving ~ df-sbc . (Contributed by NM, 31-Dec-2016.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
